post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory “offensive” category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this “offensive” category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary…

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to “offensive” NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the “Philosophy of Ruqqus.” It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as “offensive” is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let’s stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body_html:
I'm going to try to tag every user in your comment who hasn't been tagged already. Also, I'm not sure if I agree with your entire message, but I appreciate how outspoken you are about it. (I think that having some content be opt-in by default is ok as long as it's clear that it's opt-in and there's an easy way to find the content that's being hidden. I agree that the current implementation isn't good though. I'm not opposed to having a home page with opt-in categories (as long as it clearly says which categories are opt-in) while having /all show all guilds by default.)

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory “offensive” category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this “offensive” category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary…

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to “offensive” NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the “Philosophy of Ruqqus.” It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as “offensive” is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let’s stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

post.body:
**Who should decide what is offensive? If you believe in Freedom of Speech - the answer is clearly no one.**

There have been many discussions lately about implementing a mandatory “offensive” category for guilds that admins and some users believe fit this category.

It has been confirmed today that this “offensive” category will be COMPULSORY despite the assertions of @captainmeta4 to the contrary…

![](https://files.catbox.moe/c5p9s4.png)

COMPULSORY to me means it will be enforced one way or another - this is clearly the intent from the above response. 

I also believe ALL content should be OPT-OUT to prevent censorship by default.

**An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

I believe this kind of manipulation to be deeply wrong. We have all seen the affects of this to different degrees in our real lives and online. 

### What am I calling on ALL GMs of good faith to do in response to this? - Change your guild category to “offensive” NOW.

In a show of solitary for our belief in Freedom of Speech and in support of each other - this is the only honourable course of action.

This will mean none of our guilds will show in ALL by default, leaving the front page barren of any content of substance.

I believe this action by admins is clearly in contravention of their principles as stated in the “Philosophy of Ruqqus.” It is these stated principles that have brought many, if not the majority, of us here. Designating all our guilds as “offensive” is a way we can hold them accountable to these principles.

The question now is, do we stand by what we believe? If so, let’s stick together. 

**I will not cede any more ground to the cancer that is CENSORSHIP.**

body:
>It's people being upset that others are being given the option to not look at them.

No, it's not. I don't agree with them entirely, but you don't have to misrepresent what they're saying...

They're upset that these categories are opt-in only. If you just look at /all without interacting with the page, there's no way to tell that some categories are hidden. There's no "Welcome to All! Go to the sidebar to choose the categories you want to see!" message, there's no description above the category list, and there's really nothing else to indicate that some categories are not visible by default. The listing's name is "All", so why wouldn't the average user assume that all categories are visible by default? There's not even a way to check these hidden categories on mobile. That's what they're upset about. They want all the categories to be opt-out (I don't necessarily agree, but that's fine), which means others *still have the option to not look at them*.

They're also upset about your response to all this. I also think it's much of an overreaction, but I dislike seeing that you're actually banning them from your guilds for making posts about this. I'm talking about @FeverDream and the others. That looks much like shutting down dissent, and it's better to just make replies saying something like "We're going to change the categorization system so it is clearer that certain categories are going to be hidden by default. We apologize for rushing the feature." or "We won't force the offensive category on any guilds, even if we do think the guild is offensive." rather than kicking the posts and banning the authors.

Also, as for the "offensive" category, they're worried about the subjectivity of the name of the category.

I'd prefer to have /all stay as a place where all guilds are visible and to have the Home feed for logged out users and a new listing (called something like "Custom") use the categorization system, but that's just my preference.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
It's not meant to literally censor content. It's meant for growing the site in favor of more non-political users. My understanding of it is that the admins have good intentions, but they were a bit rushed and ended up making it less than satisfactory.

Actually, the thing I'm the most upset about isn't that the categories are opt-in right now. I get that the admins were trying add the categorization system as quickly as they could, and I get that they're listening to our feedback and may not be able to change it right away. I'm more upset about the admins banning users like FeverDream (the author of this post) from their guilds like +Ruqqus and +changelog, and without an explanation, it just seems like they're trying to silence dissent.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

My understanding is that free speech was the reason for the creation of the site. I'm trying to discern whether the current update is meant to literally censor content; or whether it's meant to try to grow the site in favor of people who are less interested in politics and current events as the original early adopters are/were.
Either way, I'm a voluntarist. If the site's original purpose changes so much that I don't enjoy using it, then I'd voluntarily use another site.

body:
They weren't banned today. u_MaxwellHill was [banned after giving the admins feedback](https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/5zgs/you-have-been-exiled-from-changelog) in +changelog (it's negative and strongly worded feedback for sure, but it's still feedback). FeverDream was banned after making [this post](https://ruqqus.com/+TheGreatReset/post/655t/calling-on-all-gms-in-protest). (Sure, it's unnecessary drama, but that shouldn't warrant an exile. The admins should've just made a response explaining their situation and saying that they are indeed listening to the community's feedback. In fact, kek and arkitekt did exactly that. I don't know where captainmeta4 was or what he was thinking, but he was the one who exiled the poster.)
